programme.title: Into the Congo with Ben Fogle
programme.desc: Ben heads deeper into the vast Congo wilderness to fulfil his life-long dream of seeing wild gorillas. He discovers a region experiencing rapid change.

programme.title: The World's Deadliest Weather
programme.desc: Hurricane Otis wipes out Acapulco, a small town in the UK is submerged by floods, a terrifying tornado rips through Florida and torrential rain floods parts of Italy.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall dives into the world of the caiman, learns about the plight of the world's biggest parrot and tries to find his nemesis - the giant river otter.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall heads to a place very few people ever go: Snake Island in Brazil, where the concentration of snakes is higher than anywhere else on earth.

programme.title: Mysteries Of The Mekong
programme.desc: The source of the Mekong River is high up in the Tibetan plateau, from there it flows into Yunnan Province, China, where our journey begins. Even though Yunnan occupies less than 4% of China's land, it is home to over half of its birds and mammals.

programme.title: Mysteries Of The Mekong
programme.desc: Steep mountains and tropical monsoons define the Mekong River valley on its route through Laos. Catch glimpses of the wildlife who find refuge in its vibrant ecosystems, from stump-tailed macaques to pied kingfishers to black-crested gibbons.

programme.title: Mysteries Of The Mekong
programme.desc: The temperate north meets the tropical south along the Mekong's banks in Thailand. Follow the river through the Golden Triangle and see the courtship dances of the region's abundant bird species. Then take in a festival honouring water spirits.

programme.title: Mysteries Of The Mekong
programme.desc: Explore the stunning caves of Khammouane province in Laos. These natural wonders, squeezed between the Mekong River and the Annamite Range, are home to part-time and full-time residents, including bats, geckos, frogs, and giant centipedes.

programme.title: Mysteries Of The Mekong
programme.desc: As the Mekong River travels down Thailand's eastern border, it sculpts the land, creating hundreds of small waterways through the jungle. Take a trek though lands where rhesus macaques, elephants, and flying foxes live in harmony at the water's edge.

programme.title: Wild Birds Of Australia
programme.desc: The Emu is Australia's biggest native bird and is the second largest bird in the world after the African ostrich: two meters tall, with an almost three metre running stride and totally flightless. This bird inhabits a topsy turvy world, where females call the shots, eggs are green and men do all the work to produce and raise tiny babies, known as Stripeys.

programme.title: Wildlife ER
programme.desc: Scramble as the ER team tends to a spring flood of patients. Watch vet Phil stabilize an ailing joey as the rescue team fends off a rude kangaroo. Shadow senior vet Tim, who treats a cat-scratched bandicoot and snakes a keelback out of a grate.

programme.title: Wildlife ER
programme.desc: Head out with rescuer Jo to scoop up a pelican who's swallowed a fish hook, then see Sam free a newborn bat tangled in a fence. Follow vet Tim, who aids a surly koala with an eye infection, and watch a lumpy python give newbie Ruby a load of trouble.

programme.title: Wildlife ER
programme.desc: Shadow vet Bec, who patches up dog-bitten koala Rachel, and new vets Ruby and Kerryn, who soothe a pack of itchy possums. Free a pair of kookaburras trapped in a wall with rescue officer Dani and watch vet Tim's squirrel glider knee surgery.

programme.title: Wildlife ER
programme.desc: Chase the team as they triage patients from a hoarding case, then free a tangled-up ibis with rescue officers Jo and Chantelle. Check on a baby koala that took a swan dive with vet Mel and play the waiting game with a deadly eastern brown snake.

programme.title: Wildlife ER
programme.desc: Deal with duelling duckling roundups and find out if vet Karina calls in specialists to treat koala Spike's leg fracture. Get to the bottom of stomach issues plaguing baby echidnas Ping and Pong, and meet koala Jarrah, who seems to have lost his way.

programme.title: Animals Decoded
programme.desc: Join researchers as they study how animals communicate. Find out how wolves use their body language to unite the pack and maintain a sophisticated social structure, and see the astounding number of gestures chimps use to communicate.

programme.title: Animals Like Us
programme.desc: Watch an Antarctic gentoo penguin pop the question with a rocky token of his devotion, then learn how a Madagascar lemur uses toxic millipedes for pest control. Bone up on makeup techniques with a flamingo and meet a honey badger that can pick locks.

programme.title: Animals Like Us

programme.title: Animals Like Us

programme.title: Animals Like Us
programme.desc: Go rogue with frigate birds, who steal meals from smaller seabirds; relax in a mongoose-run spa with a grateful warthog; and decode an African elephant's secret message. Then watch lovelorn capuchin monkeys hurl rocks to attract prospective mates.

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won't find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today's world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation. The Agenda: No nonsense talk; Challenging perceptions.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show
programme.desc: Join Tiana Penitani Gray and Sam Wykes for your weekly hit of Pacific joy, as they share inspiring stories and incredible sporting prowess of athletes with Pacific Island heritage from Australia and around the world. (Return)

programme.title: Landline: 30th Anniversary Special - 30th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: A look back on 30 years of telling stories about farming, agriculture, food, economics, innovation and communities from Australia's rural and regional heartland. Includes memorable moments and the people who made the show.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you today's top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: The World This Week
programme.desc: Girish Sawlani brings you a weekly roundup of international news from an Australian perspective as reported by ABC News correspondents covering the Indo Pacific, Europe, North America, the Middle East, India and Indonesia.

programme.title: Paul Kelly: Stories of Me
programme.desc: This documentary charts the remarkable life of one of Australia's most beloved singer-songwriters. For almost 40 years, in over 350 songs, Paul Kelly has been mapping out the Australian landscape and its people.

programme.title: Culture By Design - Culture
programme.desc: Design is a reflection of history, heritage and identity. This episode explores cultural roots that influence modern design with a wood block printer in Bangalore, fashion designer in Jakarta and furniture designer in Mumbai.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show
programme.desc: Join Tiana Penitani Gray and Sam Wykes for your weekly hit of Pacific joy, as they share inspiring stories and incredible sporting prowess of athletes with Pacific Island heritage from Australia and around the world. (Return)

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel discuss the week in sport including the start of the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics, Men's T20 World Cup, preparations for the Women's Cricket series Australia v India, plus football and basketball.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia - Sherwood River
programme.desc: Richard Rowles plans to live with climate change, by building a flood proof house on the banks of the volatile Brisbane River.

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan
programme.desc: The latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australia's deaf community connected and informed. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: The World This Week

programme.title: Eat The Invaders - Camel
programme.desc: Tony Armstrong visits a remote cattle station in WA to learn the harsh reality of camels and their impact on the environment and infrastructure, prompting the question why more Australians aren't eating camel meat.

programme.title: The Streets Hong Kong
programme.desc: Dan journeys to Hong Kong's picturesque coastal region of Sai Kung where local chef, Margaret Xu cooks him a sublime steamed crab dish. He then searches for a restaurant that specialises in traditional Chinese sweet soups.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: There's never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you today's top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you what's going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: Compass - The Governor-General - One Year On
programme.desc: Sam Mostyn, a modern and optimistic Governor-General, advocates daily for a "culture of care". On the eve of her first year in office, she speaks with Geraldine Doogue.

programme.title: Eat The Invaders - Camel
programme.desc: Tony Armstrong visits a remote cattle station in WA to learn the harsh reality of camels and their impact on the environment and infrastructure, prompting the question why more Australians aren't eating camel meat.

programme.title: New Leash On Life - Arty
programme.desc: Grieving migrant nurse, Rosey, wants to get a large rescue dog to help fill the void of losing her husband. Will big, beautiful but very anxious Arty be too much for first-time dog owner Rosey to handle?

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Meredith Sheehan brings you the latest news and a roundup of the day's top stories from across Australia and around the globe.

programme.title: Compass - The Governor-General - One Year On
programme.desc: Sam Mostyn, a modern and optimistic Governor-General, advocates daily for a "culture of care". On the eve of her first year in office, she speaks with Geraldine Doogue.

programme.title: Paul Kelly: Stories of Me
programme.desc: This documentary charts the remarkable life of one of Australia's most beloved singer-songwriters. For almost 40 years, in over 350 songs, Paul Kelly has been mapping out the Australian landscape and its people.

programme.title: Culture By Design - Culture
programme.desc: Design is a reflection of history, heritage and identity. This episode explores cultural roots that influence modern design with a wood block printer in Bangalore, fashion designer in Jakarta and furniture designer in Mumbai.

programme.title: The Streets Hong Kong
programme.desc: Dan journeys to Hong Kong's picturesque coastal region of Sai Kung where local chef, Margaret Xu cooks him a sublime steamed crab dish. He then searches for a restaurant that specialises in traditional Chinese sweet soups.

programme.title: Landline: 30th Anniversary Special - 30th Anniversary Special
programme.desc: A look back on 30 years of telling stories about farming, agriculture, food, economics, innovation and communities from Australia's rural and regional heartland. Includes memorable moments and the people who made the show.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: Start your Sunday morning with the show the politicians rely on to find out what's going on. David Speers presents Australia's must-watch political program, joined by a panel of the best political analysts and commentators.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel discuss the week in sport including the start of the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics, Men's T20 World Cup, preparations for the Women's Cricket series Australia v India, plus football and basketball.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent - Hot Property - Greenland
programme.desc: Greenland has been on the global agenda as US President Donald Trump has sought to takeover the country from Denmark. Lauren Day visited Greenland to speak with locals who are adamant the island is not for sale.

programme.title: The Art of Remembrance
programme.desc: Nate Byrne explores the role of paintings and sketches that represent the experiences of our service personnel and how visual art can help us to learn more about Australia's military history.

programme.title: National Press Club Address - Christopher Pyne - COTA Australia Chair
programme.desc: Christopher Pyne, Chair of the Council on the Ageing (COTA), addresses the National Press Club on the topic "State of the Older Nation".

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As each day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday present the latest news, overnight developments and today's top stories, joined by Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with what's happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: In Good Shape
programme.desc: How can we best care for our kidneys? Chronic kidney disease can lead to kidney failure - a serious health issue. In Good Shape meets people affected and finds out about treatment options, and life with one kidney.

programme.desc: At Hibuse Matsuri, the Fire Prevention Festival, men douse buildings in water as a prayer for protection from fire. At this event held in January, bonfires and sake help to keep people warm.

programme.title: (L) UFC Fight Night: Bautista vs. Oliveira - Prelims
programme.desc: The first UFC Fight Night event of the year features a combustible pairing in the bantamweight division atop the marquee as Mario Bautista faces off with Vinicius “LokDog” Oliveira. Posted at No. 9 in the bantamweight division, Bautista remains one of the most underrated talents in the 135-pound weight class, boasting victories over Jose Aldo, Ricky Simon, and Patchy Mix.

programme.title: LIGUE 1 TOP 10 ACROBATICS GOALS - LIGUE 1 TOP 10 ACROBATICS GOALS
programme.desc: Golazo! 10 of the best volleys & scissor kicks that found the net from the Ligue 1 22/23 season.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed - 1801 - British Invasion
programme.desc: It’s a British invasion of the world-famous Octagon as the top stars from across the pond show off their incredible skills on UFC Unleashed. Featuring Tom Aspinall, “Meatball” Molly McCann, and Paddy “The Baddy” Pimblett.

programme.title: UFC Main Event - UFC 306: O'Malley vs Dvalishvili
programme.desc: For the first time ever, Sphere Las Vegas hosts the UFC, as devastating striker “Suga” Sean O’Malley defends his title for the second time against the indomitable wrestler Merab “The Machine” Dvalishvili.

programme.title: LIGUE 1 TOP 10 ACROBATICS GOALS - LIGUE 1 TOP 10 ACROBATICS GOALS
programme.desc: Golazo! 10 of the best volleys & scissor kicks that found the net from the Ligue 1 22/23 season.

programme.title: UFC Reloaded - UFC 315: Muhammad vs Della Maddalena
programme.desc: When the Octagon returns to Montreal for the first time since 2015, fans are treated to a stacked card headlined by a championship doubleheader. In the main event, Belal Muhammad defends his welterweight crown for the first time against Australian powerhouse Jack Della Maddalena, and Manon Fiorot battles to be the first female French champion against Flyweight phenom Valentina Shevchenko. Plus, the return of Jose Aldo and much more on UFC Reloaded.

programme.title: Mencari Ramli Musim Ke - 4 - 12
programme.desc: Program pencarian bakat bola sepak yang hebat diteruskan lagi dengan Musim Ke-4. Program ini memberi peluang kepada bakat muda untuk merealisasikan impian mereka menjadi pemain bola sepak terbaik di peringkat kebangsaan dan antarabangsa. Program ini mencungkil bakat bola sepak anak-anak muda berusia bawah 14 tahun dan bawah 16 tahun.

programme.title: Sensasi Bola - 15
programme.desc: Sensasi Bola merupakan satu program bual bicara berdurasi setengah jam bersama pemain bola sepak, selebriti, jurulatih dan peminat sebagai tetamu undangan setiap minggu. Antara topik menarik yang akan dikupas adalah isu mengenai bola sepak tempatan dan antarabangsa, temubual ekslusif bersama lagenda bola sepak, tips kesihatan serta isu semasa yang menjadi perbualan masa kini.

programme.title: UFC Fight Flashback - UFC 305: Du Plessis vs Adesanya
programme.desc: UFC 305 featured the battle for the middleweight title as reigning champion Dricus "Stillknocks" Du Plessis defended his belt against former champion Israel "The Last Stylebender" Adesanya. See their fight like never before with enhanced replays and angles, new footage, and exclusive audio.

programme.title: UFC Reloaded - UFC 315: Muhammad vs Della Maddalena
programme.desc: When the Octagon returns to Montreal for the first time since 2015, fans are treated to a stacked card headlined by a championship doubleheader. In the main event, Belal Muhammad defends his welterweight crown for the first time against Australian powerhouse Jack Della Maddalena, and Manon Fiorot battles to be the first female French champion against Flyweight phenom Valentina Shevchenko. Plus, the return of Jose Aldo and much more on UFC Reloaded.

programme.title: UFC Ultimate Knockouts - 1103: International Fighters
programme.desc: UFC Ultimate Knockouts features explosive KOs from international fighters, showcasing stars from Russia, England, and South Africa like Dricus du Plessis, Paddy Pimblett, Ilia Topuria, and more.

programme.title: UFC Countdown - UFC 311: Makhachev vs Tsarukyan
programme.desc: UFC 311 Countdown previews two title fights, as lightweight king Islam Makhachev looks to defend his crown against Arman Tsarukyan in a rematch. Plus, bantamweight champion Merab Dvalishvili puts his belt on the line against Umar Nurmagomedov.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Bautista vs. Oliveira - Prelims
programme.desc: The first UFC Fight Night event of the year features a combustible pairing in the bantamweight division atop the marquee as Mario Bautista faces off with Vinicius “LokDog” Oliveira. Posted at No. 9 in the bantamweight division, Bautista remains one of the most underrated talents in the 135-pound weight class, boasting victories over Jose Aldo, Ricky Simon, and Patchy Mix.

programme.title: UFC 325: Volkanovski vs. Lopes 2 - Prelims
programme.desc: On Sunday, February 1, UFC returns to Sydney Olympic Park, New South Wales, Australia for UFC 325 which will be headlined by a featherweight championship rematch between titleholder Alexander “The Great” Volkanovski and challenger Diego Lopes. The duo faced off for the vacant featherweight title last April at UFC 314 in Miami, with Volkanovski earning a unanimous decision victory to reclaim in the throne in the 145-pound weight class.
